channel.title: Traefik Proxy :: book.rymcg.tech
channel.description: Traefik Proxy (Traefik) is a core service, an application gateway, for all of the service containers installed on your Docker host. Traefik is an advanced software router: it can serve hundreds of deployed application containers (routes) at the same time. Traefik has a configuration provider that operates by discovery, so that when it is installed on a Docker host, it can automatically configure itself based upon the runtime settings of each individual application it finds.

item.title: Configure Traefik
item.description: [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d make traefik config This creates a config for Traefik on your active Docker context. The configuration is driven by a text wizard menu system. (stdout) ? Traefik config main menu: > Create system user on Docker host Configure entrypoints (including dashboard) Configure Certificate Authorities (CA) Configure ACME (Let's Encrypt or Step-CA) Configure TLS certificates and domains (make certs) Configure middleware (including auth) v Configure error page template [↑↓ to move, enter to select, type to filter, ESC to cancel] Use your arrow keys to select a menu item and press the Enter key.
